name: Rep. Garret Graves
tweet_text: Previously, all FEMA grants or reimbursements greater than $35,000 required multiple, extensive reviews that often take a year or more. This means projects will be completed in a faster timeframe and local governments will receive reimbursement more quickly.

name: Rep. Garret Graves
tweet_text: Now, grant recipients such as school boards, local governments, and others will have an expedited approval process for response and recovery grant programs if their reimbursement total falls below $1 million.

name: Rep. Garret Graves
tweet_text: Before the legislation, local “small projects” – those that receive under $1 million in reimbursement from FEMA – were stuck in reimbursement purgatory. For example, some Hurricane Ida reimbursements are still in the bureaucratic process despite landfall occurring over a year ago

name: Rep. Garret Graves
tweet_text: Our bill ensures that these increased revenues will be committed to  projects that restore the coast, protect our coastal communities from  hurricanes and other disaster and, ultimately, reduce our nation’s  outrageous disaster response costs.

name: Rep. Garret Graves
tweet_text: La is battling the largest historical, ongoing and prospective loss of coastal wetlands and it’s a national crisis.  Diverting our energy $ away from efforts to improve our resiliency is a fundamentally flawed approach to addressing the maintenance backlog in national parks.

name: Rep. Garret Graves
tweet_text: The bill was considered today in conjunction with the Restore Our Parks and Public Lands Act, which  proposed using Gulf offshore energy revenues to address the maintenance  backlog of the National Park Service and other agencies across the  country.

name: Rep. Garret Graves
tweet_text: Our bill,   H.R. 6771 amends the Gulf of Mexico Energy Security Act 2006 (GOMESA) to bring Gulf offshore energy revenue sharing in line with levels that onshore  energy producing states enjoy – an effort long pursued by Louisiana’s  congressional delegation.

name: Rep. Garret Graves
tweet_text: After working on this for 20 years I can tell you:  what happened today  is historic. Moving this bill is a big deal and has enormous implications for South Louisiana. https://t.co/HTLf1b49Ed

name: Rep. Garret Graves
tweet_text: 5. With #TaxReform , we now have a much simpler process. Filing your taxes should not be as hard as it's been for the past 31 years, and after today it will be as simple as filing with a postcard.#TaxDay #TaxCutsandJobsAct

name: Rep. Garret Graves
tweet_text: With this repeal families will be able to buy the health insurance that is right for them.  #TaxCutsandJobsAct #TaxDay https://t.co/mXBTKgU7c6

name: Rep. Garret Graves
tweet_text: 4. ACA RELIEF. Finally, in the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act we were able to repeal the crippling "individual mandate" embedded in the Affordable Care Act. This was a totally unfair tax, it was ineffective, and people shouldn't be forced to buy government-mandated health insurance.

name: Rep. Garret Graves
tweet_text: 3. The new tax code doubles the Child Tax Credit from $1,000 to $2,000, which helps people all across the country care for their family, while also protecting the Child and Dependent Care Tax Credit and Adoption Credit. This is great news for families.

name: Rep. Garret Graves
tweet_text: 2. The Tax Cuts and Jobs Act nearly DOUBLED the standard deduction. Specifically, the new tax code will increase the standard deduction from $12,000 to $24,000 for married couples, which will protect more folks' income from being taxed. #TaxDay #TaxCutsandJobsAct

name: Rep. Garret Graves
tweet_text: 1. Lower tax rates for Americans across the board.  In communities across our nation people are experiences benefits of lower tax rates. In La., the typical family of 4 will see a tax cut. This means you get to keep more of your hard-earned money to spend or save how YOU see fit. https://t.co/5RuXXrXTFI

name: Rep. Garret Graves
tweet_text: It's a historic tax day today, with this year being the very last time we file our taxes using the old tax code. In honor of Tax Day 2018, today we will highlight 5 ways that the new tax code will be better than the old one...#TaxDay  #TaxCuts

tweet_text: Project efficiency is not limited to highways. The West Shore flood control project was in the STUDY phase for 42 years before proposed for construction.  And construction still hasn't started.

tweet_text: There is no doubt we need more money to support infrastructure in the capital region but we can't keep spending money in the same system that got us to this point.

name: Rep. Garret Graves
tweet_text: We don't have years of infrastructure investment to catch up on. We have decades.

name: Rep. Garret Graves
tweet_text: In addition the bill includes a change that may result in a small increase in coastal restoration and hurricane protection funding for Louisiana by amending offshore energy revenue sharing law.

name: Rep. Garret Graves
tweet_text: La wins in the bill: our flood and other disaster victims get the tax breaks we’ve fought for all year long, we preserved tax incentives uniquely critical for community development, historic preservation, economic reinvestment and higher education.

name: Rep. Garret Graves
tweet_text: Finally, this bill helps eliminate the strategic advantage that foreign companies hold over America’s small biz by providing competitive tax rates. It provides opportunities for Americans by creating jobs here in our country not overseas and helps to increase $ for our families.

name: Rep. Garret Graves
tweet_text: This means that Washington takes less while individuals, families and job creators keep more. That’s a good thing! https://t.co/j2OJIbKbwX

name: Rep. Garret Graves
tweet_text: This bill will lower taxes across every income tax bracket, nearly double the standard deduction and give people back their freedom to make healthcare decisions without having to pay a government-imposed penalty and lifting some of the tax burden on our small businesses.

name: Rep. Garret Graves
tweet_text: Passage of these landmark policy changes represent major movement toward regional flexibility, tailored management strategies that favor local over federal control, better data collection and enhanced responsiveness to the needs of recreational anglers and mixed use fisheries.

name: Rep. Garret Graves
tweet_text: Our Modern Fish Act and two other common-sense amendments were also approved Wednesday as part of broader committee action to reauthorize and modernize the Magnuson-Stevens Act, the fishing law of the land.

tweet_text: The DRRA requires FEMA and other agencies work to implement a streamlined process whereby disaster victims can provide information one time to a federal agency rather than having to apply multiple times to multiple agencies for disaster assistance.

name: Rep. Garret Graves
tweet_text: Ultimately saving taxpayer dollars.  The bill also funds a “surge” of building inspectors to help address permitting and assessment activities that typically delay rebuilding and recovery.

name: Rep. Garret Graves

tweet_text: After 31 years, it’s time for common sense tax reform.  Learn more here: https://t.co/5qNRabecIY

name: Rep. Garret Graves
tweet_text: All while boosting our economy.

name: Rep. Garret Graves
tweet_text: Tax cuts will allow hard-working Americans to keep their money in their pockets to save, invest, or spend it how THEY see fit…

name: Rep. Garret Graves
tweet_text: We want our nation to be competitive, but the code we have on the books now is crippling to our country’s businesses.

name: Rep. Garret Graves
tweet_text: America has the highest corporate tax rate in the WORLD.

name: Rep. Garret Graves
tweet_text: 2.  We have got to cut taxes across the board…

name: Rep. Garret Graves
tweet_text: In fact, filing your taxes should be as easy as filling out a postcard.

name: Rep. Garret Graves
tweet_text: Americans need a simple and fair tax code, one that’s easy to understand.

name: Rep. Garret Graves
tweet_text: It’s actually 74,608 pages and 2.4 MILLION words long to be exact… It’s ridiculous.

name: Rep. Garret Graves
tweet_text: 1. The current tax code is incredibly complicated…

tweet_text: With the uneven playing field created by our current tax policy,  thousands of working and middle class jobs have moved overseas.

name: Rep. Garret Graves
tweet_text: Too much of our national income is currently being drained by complying with tax laws.  Taxpayers deserve better.

name: Rep. Garret Graves
tweet_text: Bottom line, we need common sense tax reform.  Check out our plan here: https://t.co/5qNRabecIY

name: Rep. Garret Graves
tweet_text: ...because the tax code is too long and too complex.

name: Rep. Garret Graves
tweet_text: Americans spend hundreds of billions of dollars each year on tax lawyers, accountants, and other costs associated with tax compliance...

name: Rep. Garret Graves
tweet_text: We need to reform the tax code to make it simpler and fairer for individuals, families and businesses.

name: Rep. Garret Graves
tweet_text: We have a deficit and growing national debt, not because Americans don’t pay enough taxes, but because Washington spends too much.

tweet_text: The I-12 wall exacerbated the flooding, it goes on for miles & there are no drainage features.
